natural problem: One US dollar is the equivalent of 7 Namibian dollars.  One US dollar is also the equivalent of 6 Chinese yuan. If a painting costs 105 Namibian dollars, how much would it cost in Chinese yuan?
natural solution: Since 7 Namibian dollars ($\text{N}\$$) is equal to 1 US dollar (USD), 105 Namibian dollars is equal to $\text{N}\$105\left(\dfrac{1\;\text{USD}}{\text{N}\$7}\right) = 15\;\text{USD}$. Since 1 US dollar (USD) is equal to 6 Chinese yuan (CNY), 105 Namibian dollars is equal to 15 US dollars is equal to $15\;\text{USD}\left(\dfrac{6\;\text{CNY}}{1\;\text{USD}}\right) = \boxed{90}\;\text{yuan}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes US_dollar Namibian_dollar Chinese_yuan :: real
assumes h0 : "1 * US_dollar = 7 * Namibian_dollar"
and h1 : "1 * US_dollar = 6 * Chinese_yuan"
and h2 : "105 * Namibian_dollar = painting_cost"
shows  "painting_cost_in_yuan = 90 * Chinese_yuan"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 One US dollar is the equivalent of 7 Namibian dollars.  One US dollar is also the equivalent of 6 Chinese yuan. If a painting costs 105 Namibian dollars, how much would it cost in Chinese yuan? The final Answer is 90
 ### Proof
 Since 7 Namibian dollars ($\text{N}\$$) is equal to 1 US dollar (USD), 105 Namibian dollars is equal to $\text{N}\$105\left(\dfrac{1\;\text{USD}}{\text{N}\$7}\right) = 15\;\text{USD}$. Since 1 US dollar (USD) is equal to 6 Chinese yuan (CNY), 105 Namibian dollars is equal to 15 US dollars is equal to $15\;\text{USD}\left(\dfrac{6\;\text{CNY}}{1\;\text{USD}}\right) = \boxed{90}\;\text{yuan}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes US_dollar Namibian_dollar Chinese_yuan :: real
assumes h0 : "1 * US_dollar = 7 * Namibian_dollar"
and h1 : "1 * US_dollar = 6 * Chinese_yuan"
and h2 : "105 * Namibian_dollar = painting_cost"
shows  "painting_cost_in_yuan = 90 * Chinese_yuan"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If 1 US dollar equals 7 Namibian dollars and also equals 6 Chinese yuan, how much would a painting cost in Chinese yuan if it costs 105 Namibian dollars? The final answer is 90 Chinese yuan.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes USD NAD CNY :: real
assumes h0 : "1 * USD = 7 * NAD"
and h1 : "1 * USD = 6 * CNY"
and h2 : "105 * NAD = x * CNY"
shows  "x = 90"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 One US dollar is the equivalent of 7 Namibian dollars.  One US dollar is also the equivalent of 6 Chinese yuan. If a painting costs 105 Namibian dollars, how much would it cost in Chinese yuan? The final Answer is 90

 *)

theorem
fixes USD NAD CNY :: real
assumes h0 : "1 * USD = 7 * NAD"
and h1 : "1 * USD = 6 * CNY"
and h2 : "105 * NAD = x * CNY"
shows  "x = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
